title: Grants additional credit on promotional examinations for police officers and firefighters who are residents of certain cities
summary: Grants additional credit on promotional examinations for police officers and firefighters who are residents of a city with a population between 250,000 and one million upon enactment of a local law.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1832

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  PEOPLES-STOKES, SCARBOROUGH -- read once and
         referred to the Committee on Governmental Employees

       AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to  promotional  exam
         credits for police officers and firefighters in certain cities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 52 of the civil service law is amended by adding  a
    2  new subdivision 16 to read as follows:
    3    16.  CREDIT  FOR RESIDENT POLICE OFFICERS AND FIREFIGHTERS. (A) A CITY
    4  WITH A POPULATION BETWEEN TWO HUNDRED FIFTY THOUSAND AND ONE MILLION  IS
    5  AUTHORIZED TO ADOPT A LOCAL LAW WHICH WOULD GRANT RESIDENTS OF SUCH CITY
    6  ADDITIONAL  CREDITS  IN PROMOTIONAL EXAMINATIONS FOR A POLICE OFFICER OR
    7  FIREFIGHTER.
    8    (B) IN THE EVENT OF THE ENACTMENT OF A LOCAL LAW PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH
    9  (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION, ON AN ELIGIBLE LIST  RESULTING  FROM  A  PROMO-
   10  TIONAL  EXAMINATION  FOR  A  POLICE OFFICER OR FIREFIGHTER, THE NAMES OF
   11  ELIGIBLES SHALL BE ENTERED IN THE ORDER OF THEIR RESPECTIVE FINAL EARNED
   12  RATINGS ON EXAMINATION, WITH THE NAME OF THE ELIGIBLE WITH  THE  HIGHEST
   13  FINAL EARNED RATING AT THE HEAD OF SUCH LIST; PROVIDED HOWEVER, THAT FOR
   14  THE  PURPOSES  OF  DETERMINING  FINAL  EARNED RATINGS, A PERSON WHO IS A
   15  RESIDENT OF SUCH CITY SHALL BE ENTITLED TO  RECEIVE  FIVE  POINTS  ADDI-
   16  TIONAL CREDIT. SUCH ADDITIONAL CREDIT SHALL BE ADDED TO THE FINAL EARNED
   17  RATING  AFTER  SUCH  PERSON HAS QUALIFIED IN THE PROMOTIONAL EXAMINATION
   18  AND SHALL BE GRANTED ONLY AT THE TIME OF ESTABLISHMENT OF THE  RESULTING
   19  ELIGIBLE LIST.
   20    (C)  ANY  CANDIDATE  WHO  BELIEVES THAT HE OR SHE IS ENTITLED TO ADDI-
   21  TIONAL CREDIT AS PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION MAY MAKE  AN  APPLICATION  FOR
   22  SUCH  ADDITIONAL  CREDIT AT ANY TIME BETWEEN THE DATE OF APPLICATION FOR
   23  THE EXAMINATION AND THE DATE OF THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE ELIGIBLE  LIST.
   24  SUCH  CANDIDATE SHALL PROVIDE APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTARY PROOF OF RESIDENCY
   25  AS REQUIRED BY SUCH CITY OF RESIDENCY.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04713-01-1

       A. 1832                             2

    1    (D) THE ADDITIONAL CREDIT PROVIDED BY THIS SECTION SHALL BE  IN  ADDI-
    2  TION TO ANY ADDITIONAL CREDIT THAT MAY BE GRANTED PURSUANT TO ANY GENER-
    3  AL, SPECIAL OR LOCAL LAW.
    4    (E) ANY LOCAL LAW ADOPTED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL BE APPLICABLE
    5  ONLY  TO PROMOTIONAL EXAMINATIONS FOR A POLICE OFFICER OR FIREFIGHTER OF
    6  SUCH CITY WHICH ARE HELD AT LEAST THIRTY DAYS AFTER THE ADOPTION OF SUCH
    7  LOCAL LAW.
    8    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
